thread.title: Tunisia: 4G Telecommunication Services - Tender to Be Launched in September - Fehri
thread.title_full: Tunisia: 4G Telecommunication Services - Tender to Be Launched in September - Fehri

title: Tunisia: 4G Telecommunication Services - Tender to Be Launched in September - Fehri
text:
Libya: Four Tunisian Terrorists Arrested in Border With Libya 
Tunis — Minister of Communication Technologies and Digital Economy, Noomen Fehri announced, Monday, that the tender for the marketing of 4G telecommunication services will be launched in September 2015 while the granting of licences to operators is scheduled for summer 2016. 
Speaking on the sidelines of the opening of workshop on the project entitled "Quality of service, supply chain and product development in the Arab region during the 2013-2016 cycle," the minister added that the 4G services will be gradually generalised. 
For this purpose, he added, we will ask operators to move in priority towards marketing this technology in non-profitable regions initially to ensure equal chances between the different regions of the country and promote their development. 
Fehri said the 4G will help improve Internet services in Tunisia which remain "poor and expensive." Tunisia
